audio_script.text: Black holes are some of the most mysterious and powerful objects in the universe.
audio_script.speaker: default

audio_script.text: Formed when massive stars collapse under their own gravity, they create a region in space where nothing can escape—not even light.
audio_script.speaker: narrator_male

audio_script.text: The boundary of a black hole is called the event horizon. Once something crosses this boundary, it is lost forever.
audio_script.speaker: narrator_female

audio_script.text: At the center lies the singularity, a point of infinite density where the laws of physics break down.
audio_script.speaker: narrator_male

audio_script.text: Scientists study black holes using powerful telescopes and simulations, revealing their effects on surrounding stars and galaxies.
audio_script.speaker: default
